title: Man arrested after car wash slaying released from custody
content:
MT. MORRIS TWP, MI - A man who was in police custody following the shooting death at a car wash is now free.
Chief Terence Green told The Flint Journal on Thursday, June 30, that the suspect was released pending further investigation into the slaying of 17-year-old Alerio Wilson.
A woman who also was in police custody following the shooting was previously released, Green said.
"It's a complicated investigation," he said.
Green said there are no other suspects.
Genesee County Prosecutor David Leyton said there was not probable cause to issue an arrest warrant in the slaying.
Officers responded to 911 calls at about 9:15 a.m. on Monday, June 27 to Pierson Road and Pierson Place for reports of an altercation between two men. As police were headed to the call, more 911 calls came in for reports shots fired.
When police got to Mattis Auto Wash, 3466 Pierson Place, they found Wilson dead in the doorway.
Police said the altercation started in the nearby Suffolk Court apartments.
Dominic Adams is a reporter for The Flint Journal. Contact him at dadams5@mlive.com or 810-241-8803. Follow him on Twitter, Facebook or Google+.
